title: Takeaways from Indian Wells -- and what they mean for Miami Open
description: Will Djokovic and Swiatek turn their season around? Can Andreeva continue her incredible run? The biggest questions as the Miami Open begins.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: 'I guess I have to think of some new goals now': Inside Mirra Andreeva's meteoric rise in 2025
description: Mirra Andreeva predicted she'd win her first 1000-level tournament this year. In February she did it -- and since then she's surpassed all expectations.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Sabalenka powers to Miami Open final win against Pegula
description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka claims her second title of the year by beating Jessica Pegula 7-5 6-2 in the women's Miami Open final.

title: Djokovic reaches Miami final to close on 100th title
description: Novak Djokovic cruises past Grigor Dimitrov to reach his first Miami Open final since 2016 and move within one win of his 100th career ATP title

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Miami Open men's singles final ready to begin
description: The men's singles final between Novak Djokovic and Jakub Mensik was scheduled for not before 3 p.m. local time (EDT) on Sunday, but play was delayed due to rain. The women's doubles competitors completed their final just shy of 8:15 p.m. local time, leaving the men's singles final to complete the tournament. The women’s doubles final was scheduled first inside Hard Rock Stadium, but play was suspended in that match after three games due to rain. They resumed their clash just after 6:45 p.m. in Miami.  Both Djokovic and Mensik will be chasing a milestone title in Sunday’s clash at Hard Rock Stadium. By lifting the trophy, the 37-year-old Djokovic would become just the third man, after Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer, to lift 100 tour-level titles. It would also be a record seventh Miami triumph for the Serbian, who is currently tied with his fellow ATP No. 1 Club member Andre Agassi on six titles won at the Florida event. Meanwhile #NextGenATP star Mensik is aiming to become an ATP Tour champion for the first time at the age of 19. The Czech would be just the fourth player to win their maiden tour-level title at an ATP Masters 1000 event, and the first since 2001. Read More From Miami: Djokovic on quest for title No. 100: 'It is a great opportunity' How It All Adds Up For #NextGenATP Mensik Arevalo/Pavic Complete Sunshine Double [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Miami tennis schedule?
description: Novak Djokovic will aim for another piece of history Sunday at the Miami Open presented by Itau, where the Serbian is seeking his 100th tour-level title and a record-breaking seventh Miami trophy. The Serbian faces Jakub Mensik in the championship match at 3 p.m. local time. UPDATE: The Miami singles final has been delayed by rain. Check this article for updates. At age 37 and 10 months, Djokovic is the oldest finalist in ATP Masters 1000 series history (since 1990). He seeks to surpass Andre Agassi (6) for most Miami titles.  View the full Sunday order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - SUNDAY, 30 MARCH 2025 Stadium - start 12:30 p.m. WTA Doubles Final Not Before 3 p.m. ATP - Singles Final - Jakub Mensik (CZE) vs [4] Novak Djokovic (SRB) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Miami Open 2025 Day 10 Semi Final Recap
description: Day 10 at the 2025 Miami Open delivered two semi-finals at opposite ends of the age spectrum. 19-year-old Jakub Mensik thundered 25 aces to upset Taylor Fritz 7-6(4), 4-6, 7-6(4), while 37-year-old Novak Djokovic dispatched Grigor Dimitrov 6-2, 6-3 with a serving clinic, landing a career-high 87% of his first serves. Mensik, the third-lowest-ranked finalist …
author: Jonathan

title: Miami Open 2025 Day 9 Recap
description: Day 9 at the 2025 Miami Open delivered a mix of veteran savvy and youthful ambition, as Novak Djokovic locked down Sebastian Korda 6-3, 7-6(4) to become the oldest Miami Masters semi-finalist in history, while Taylor Fritz battled past Matteo Berrettini 7-5, 6-7(7), 7-5 in a nail-biter. Jakub Mensik stole the show, powering past Arthur …
author: Jonathan
